result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan Alexander Johnson

records.addlTxt:
2:00 PM Defendant Jordan Alexander Johnson in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Jordan Alexander Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Masana states he's hoping the matter will be resolved - requests PH - time limits waived.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:55 PM Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jordan Alexander Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger appeared by video for Jordan Alexander Johnson.  Atty Getsinger explains missed court appearance due to believing he was not needed to be present and was unable to get ahold of Atty Masana.  State requests $100 cash bond.  Atty Getsinger recommends $50 cash.  Court reinstates previous signature bond.
Return date scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on September 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Body

2:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess and Intern, Dan Moon, in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jordan Alexander Johnson not in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Jordan Alexander Johnson.  Court notes notice was not returned.  Atty Masana has no record.  State requests a warrant.
Return date on July 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
for discovery and notice of witness list

1:48 PM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jordan Alexander Johnson in court.  Court states case and appearances.  Court quashes warrant previously issued now that DE has appeared.  Court notes history of DE wishing to have counsel and DE being previously denied court-appointed counsel.  DE provides some income paperwork to the Court for her to review.  DE states he will be working at Spring Brook Construction soon.  DE states he's in training at Spring Brook right now and has been for 2 weeks.  Court finds DE conditionally indigent and appoints Atty Peter Masana (608) 448-4109.  To reimburse Clerk of Courts Office $100/month beginning on or before 8/1/2022 and then by the first of each month thereafter.  Wage assignment to be completed with Spring Brook Construction.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Return date scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on July 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on June 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:02 PM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jordan Alexander Johnson not in court.  State requests warrant.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 3:00 PM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Jordan Johnson appears in person.  Court quashes warrant.  Court declines the petition for counsel.  Court suggests DE bring last 2 months of his paystubs to support his petition.
2:30 PM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests a warrant.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.
DENIED
2:43 PM Defendant Jordan Alexander Johnson in court. Court reviews financial information.  Court cannot find that DE is indigent and denies the Petition for counsel.

records.addlTxt: Indigency hearing on May 3, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Absolute sobriety; No bars/taverns/liquor stores or any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol; No contact & many not be on the premises of Brat Haus in Lake Delton

Status hearing on May 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Return date on June 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:51 PM Defendant Jordan Alexander Johnson by Zoom audio and video from LEC with attorney Allison A Markoski by Zoom audio and video.  Defendant Jordan Alexander Johnson in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  DE does not qualify for public defender representation.  Atty Markoski updates DE's address.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  State recommends a signature bond.  No objection from Atty Markoski.  $500.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety at all times.  No bars, taverns, liquor stores, or any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  No contact and may not be on the premises of the Brat Haus in the Village of Lake Delton.  No possession of alcohol.  Status hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
